positive.review:
A 69.4 hours gameplay.

Game is defined & refined, Civ + Age of Empire mixture; combination of City Acquistion + Building -- real time strategy gameplay! You build a up to 9 or 10 cities (on your own or can go above that by conquering more cities of opponents!) then you build stuffs like library, university, markets, wonders etc. around that said cities. 

the gameplay loop is CLASSIC, and sweet; the resource is automated and gain per/sec. Seeing the number goes up is sky high! 

Rating: 89% out of 100, combat and units can be improved.

P.S. I am looking for players to co-op against AI, typed here, anyone?!
Rise of Nations is awesome, a fun, family game that involves war-strategy and logic in a fun battle-scenario. Overall, a great game.
Without a doubt, one of the greatest strategy games ever. Easily in the top 5.
Very fun and relaxing game. Very basic to learn after the tutorial and a regular game.

x-- 7/10 --x

Excellent game. 
I did not play the original so I cannot compare, but this version was a lot of fun.
It's an old game and it still holds up. Being able to save multiplayer games makes it worth the purchase. One of the best RTSs ever made.
Eternal classic. Have been rocking since I was a little kid -- never forgot it. Bought to support the developer. Still good!
Fun RTS that works well on low spec machines. Good resource management and tech trees coupled with a decent AI opponent. Recommended for fans of Command and Conquer or Starcraft.
Classic RTS with tech trees advancing from Bronze to Modern ages. The single player campaigns are fun, but not super deep by modern standards.
Feels good mayne. Rightfully placing my crown on the eugenics based throne in this RTS

i bought this game recently because i remember playing this when i was a kid and boy was it worth it only painful thing is this is its easily one of the best RTS ever made and was ahead of its time a shame we wont get a rise of nations 2 or a remaster that it deserves
This game is the mix of AEO2 and CIV VI. It is a simple, but fun game. I strongly recommend to those strategy gamer enthusiastics.

Classic game. If you like games with a similar style to Age of Empires, you will enjoy this one. A little different, in some ways more detailed and in-dept. Would recommend this game for anyone looking for a casual, laid back game to relax with in your down time.

Excellent real-time strategy game with easy user interface. Game play is intuitive and only takes minutes for you to understand the controls and shortcuts.  Good for first time strategy and live action battle players, or for more experienced players just looking for a chance to unwind with a quick game that doesn't require hours of dedicated time.
I always loved AOE games but after playing Rise of Nations the game changed my taste for ever for the RTS genre.. I hope ONE DAY to see the series back...
Very good strategy game. Can recommend!
really fun game would be nice to have muliplayer thought
yes it is old but still fun to play with family
Still great fun after all these years! GG.
one of the best games ever made! Where is rise of legends?!
Old but still pretty fun
Excellent strategy game even to this day.
It is quite a bit of fun for an older RTS
This is the best game I have ever played
Best game ever, of its type
This game is perfect
very good.
love it
:) good.
best RTS ever
Tank vs Horses
good but glitchy
Great game

The only thing rising here..... hehe well let's just say it's my






Ever growing force of cavalry troops that should flank from the side and hold off any reinforcements that are supposed to get into the surrounded city.
ซื้อ มหาสงคราม
This game is incredible. You can nuke nations that are still in the stone age
I feel old playing this game. Then again, it's gold. Every mission/custom game takes a toll of time but a time well spent is not wasted at all.

Rise of Nations is a classic RTS that still holds up in terms of strategy and gameplay, but it desperately needs a definitive edition. The mechanics and depth are fantastic, yet the visuals and interface feel dated compared to modern standards. For anyone who loves strategy games, it’s still worth playing, but a proper remaster could bring it to the level it truly deserves.

Timeless classic. Wish they did a remaster this game.. 

Here is to hoping..
Even though it's an old game, it's still fun to play. After all these years I can still boot up and enjoy myself for hours and hours
One of my favorite games from childhood. A perfect spot between Civilization and Command & Conquer.

A 69.4 hours gameplay.

Game is defined & refined, Civ + Age of Empire mixture; combination of City Acquistion + Building -- real time strategy gameplay! You build a up to 9 or 10 cities (on your own or can go above that by conquering more cities of opponents!) then you build stuffs like library, university, markets, wonders etc. around that said cities. 

the gameplay loop is CLASSIC, and sweet; the resource is automated and gain per/sec. Seeing the number goes up is sky high! 

Rating: 89% out of 100, combat and units can be improved.

P.S. I am looking for players to co-op against AI, typed here, anyone?!

This is by far the best city building game I've ever played. To think that the game itself is really over 20 years old is wild! I just recently started playing it because a friend told me that the game "Age of Empires" was made because of this game. Don't know if it's true but I highly recommend this game! I wish there was a way to drag the game out of a period of days though. Like conflict of nations.
Rise of Nations is awesome, a fun, family game that involves war-strategy and logic in a fun battle-scenario. Overall, a great game.

"Rise of Nations: Extended Edition successfully modernizes a classic strategy gem, offering a vast sweep of history with compelling nation progression, dynamic warfare, and a refined remaster that feels fluid even today. While some visuals and UI oddities remain from its original release, the core gameplay, challenging AI, and broad empire-building options ensure hours of engaging, tactical fun for newcomers and veteran strategists alike—an RTS worth (re)discovering!
Without a doubt, one of the greatest strategy games ever. Easily in the top 5.
it is challenging and very well done in the graphics and ai.

x-- 7/10 --x

Excellent game. 
I did not play the original so I cannot compare, but this version was a lot of fun.
It's an old game and it still holds up. Being able to save multiplayer games makes it worth the purchase. One of the best RTSs ever made.
Eternal classic. Have been rocking since I was a little kid -- never forgot it. Bought to support the developer. Still good!
Fun RTS that works well on low spec machines. Good resource management and tech trees coupled with a decent AI opponent. Recommended for fans of Command and Conquer or Starcraft.
A fantastic game. I played the original version from CDs a decade ago, and am still playing with family to this day. It's our one game we can all agree to play together.
Oldies now whats this game really are,its my childhood!,and now its still fun!(with and without cheats!)
It's the classic 4x RTS we all know and love, but brought up to date for modern hardware. Runs like a dream on my PC, and has enough quality of life improvements to make it a joy to play.

got to appdate folder something...GDIcursor=1 fixes input lag, download mods for balance rework! This game is still great! Careful for overheating there is bug. Play only on your own risk set up HWINFO always have warning for overheating!!! This game can overheat 780 on pc to 85C but on new pc no issue 4060

old school but still fun
is precuisor to mobile dominations game

This game is more than 20 years old, but I still love it.   Like most great RTS titles,  it can have a somewhat steep learning curve.  But it is well worth the effort.  I bought a gaming laptop around the time the game came out,  and at the time you didn't need to be online to play most PC games.  So the game went everywhere with me and was the only game I played for about a year or more with my offline laptop.
One of the best RTS ever made you're incredibly missing out by not playing this puppy an absolute master piece!
One of my favourites strategy games of all times where diplomacy and resources evolve and battles demand a good amount of strategy in order to be efficient. I just love it.

The best RTS for me :)
It has many resources, many different units, and spans across all of the historical times
Perfect in my eyes!

Oh and the soundtracks... Oh god!
If you are someone who uses RTS games as a stress release this is the game for you, brings back a lot of childhood memories. But this game from steam does have some bugs in it.

[h1]One Of the Classic RTS games from the early 00's...[/h1]

I've always loved Rise of Nations, mostly because it was the first rts i played that let me have nukes. 

This is another on of those games that time has move on from but If you want to take a look back at a classic then this is a good package to do it
Classic RTS with tech trees advancing from Bronze to Modern ages. The single player campaigns are fun, but not super deep by modern standards.

[b] Waiting on player.. waiting on player.. waiting on player.. [/b]

This game can heal ebola 10/10
Feels good mayne. Rightfully placing my crown on the eugenics based throne in this RTS

i bought this game recently because i remember playing this when i was a kid and boy was it worth it only painful thing is this is its easily one of the best RTS ever made and was ahead of its time a shame we wont get a rise of nations 2 or a remaster that it deserves
Awesome Game.  A lightweight way to learn about history in a fun way as well.
Easy to understand and play without reading rules or guidelines.
Very fun and relaxing game. Very basic to learn after the tutorial and a regular game.
This game is the mix of AEO2 and CIV VI. It is a simple, but fun game. I strongly recommend to those strategy gamer enthusiastics.

Classic game. If you like games with a similar style to Age of Empires, you will enjoy this one. A little different, in some ways more detailed and in-dept. Would recommend this game for anyone looking for a casual, laid back game to relax with in your down time.

Excellent real-time strategy game with easy user interface. Game play is intuitive and only takes minutes for you to understand the controls and shortcuts.  Good for first time strategy and live action battle players, or for more experienced players just looking for a chance to unwind with a quick game that doesn't require hours of dedicated time.
I always loved AOE games but after playing Rise of Nations the game changed my taste for ever for the RTS genre.. I hope ONE DAY to see the series back...

I've had this game since it came out on disk in the early 2000's. No mater what I keep coming back to it. Its a fantastic game and lots of fun. Yes, its old and as such has a few quirks and limits but I enjoy it every time I play.

I had this game on disk for more than half my life, ive probably played 2k hours.
I think in 2025 i wouldnt wana recommend it to anyone i know but if youre some kind of super enthusiast for rts games definitly try it and figure out the map editor but dont blame me when you start a cold war campaign and then task manager out because it looks like cursed risk.
This game is my childhood. I actuarly LOVE this game. So if you like some strategy games, you should buy this one.

My childhood game, I discovered it around 2011–2013, and since then I’ve been playing it regularly. In my opinion, it’s almost as good as Age of Empires, but it’s a pity they didn’t continue with more updates or DLCs. It’s one of the best strategy games of all time, definitely a top 3.
Very cool older strategy game to play with friends, or solo. Would 100% recommend.
please update this game its starting to glitch really bad
Very good strategy game. Can recommend!
really fun game would be nice to have muliplayer thought
Still an amazing RTS game would recommend played a ton when I was young
Super engaging RTS. Its an oldie but a goodie.
If you like history stuff this game is severely underrated
yes it is old but still fun to play with family
Very fun. Good strategy game.
Still great fun after all these years! GG.
one of the best games ever made! Where is rise of legends?!
Childhood Classic that still bangs imo
Old but still pretty fun
Enjoyabe and challenging
criminally underknown game
Excellent strategy game even to this day.
Almost 25 years of gameplay.. GOATED rts
It is quite a bit of fun for an older RTS
very fun with friends
love beating my illiterate friends in this one
ah nostalgia what a great game
Strong opponent
This is the best game I have ever played

negative.review: This game is decades old. There are flaws if running with new computers, starting build from 2020 and newer and you will find forums having issues. It crashed to desktop with error message like "Can't create vertex buffer" or error mentioning "d3dgl.dll" file, you are not likely going to enjoy this if you want hassle free & casual gaming. Visit community forums about errors related to this game, my advice is not to buy it because it will waste your time and setback progress for 20min at least.

Do not pay $20 for this game! Rise of Nations came out in 2003, it is 22 years old as of the time of this posting. It's outdated and so buggy, with all kinds of glitches, some graphical. The game dynamics itself are very unbalanced. It's insane to me that they still expect to get $20 for this hunk of junk.

Hey Microsoft! Have some shame and remaster this game before selling it in 2025! Even the music cracks because it's so old. I play it because Civ series is Turn Based which I don't like as a genre but I wish, I SO WISH that there was a modern RTS Civ! Or a proper Rise of Nations sequel!!
I love this game but 20$ is C R A Z Y for this old ass game LOL
This game did not age well.
play rise of nations on roblox

This game is decades old. There are flaws if running with new computers, starting build from 2020 and newer and you will find forums having issues. It crashed to desktop with error message like "Can't create vertex buffer" or error mentioning "d3dgl.dll" file, you are not likely going to enjoy this if you want hassle free & casual gaming. Visit community forums about errors related to this game, my advice is not to buy it because it will waste your time and setback progress for 20min at least.

Do not pay $20 for this game! Rise of Nations came out in 2003, it is 22 years old as of the time of this posting. It's outdated and so buggy, with all kinds of glitches, some graphical. The game dynamics itself are very unbalanced. It's insane to me that they still expect to get $20 for this hunk of junk.
I don't know man it's missing that hook you know. It failed to capture me like rusted warfare did. I mean rusted warfare has something that rise of nations lacks. I had to refund it unfortunately..

Just not my thing. There's better grand strategy games, better RTS games, better 4x games, etc.  Play Civ, Play Starcraft or COH, play Total War, play Stellaris, play age of empires. 

I really did give this game a fair shake, I really did, there's just absolutely nothing in this game that isn't being done better by another game, even in a combined package.

I think this game is more nostalgia bait, if you grew up playing this game, if this was your first RTS or strategy game, you're probably gonna wanna come back to this game and play it a lot, but in terms of actual quality, even the mods don't make up for it.

Speaking of, don't let the near 20,000 mods on the workshop fool you, once you get past page 3 of the most subscribed mods....it's pure bloat and slop.

Now Rise of Legends on the other hand....but that's not on steam.

Hey Microsoft! Have some shame and remaster this game before selling it in 2025! Even the music cracks because it's so old. I play it because Civ series is Turn Based which I don't like as a genre but I wish, I SO WISH that there was a modern RTS Civ! Or a proper Rise of Nations sequel!!

This game is decades old. There are flaws if running with new computers, starting build from 2020 and newer and you will find forums having issues. It crashed to desktop with error message like "Can't create vertex buffer" or error mentioning "d3dgl.dll" file, you are not likely going to enjoy this if you want hassle free & casual gaming. Visit community forums about errors related to this game, my advice is not to buy it because it will waste your time and setback progress for 20min at least.

Do not pay $20 for this game! Rise of Nations came out in 2003, it is 22 years old as of the time of this posting. It's outdated and so buggy, with all kinds of glitches, some graphical. The game dynamics itself are very unbalanced. It's insane to me that they still expect to get $20 for this hunk of junk.
I don't know man it's missing that hook you know. It failed to capture me like rusted warfare did. I mean rusted warfare has something that rise of nations lacks. I had to refund it unfortunately..

Just not my thing. There's better grand strategy games, better RTS games, better 4x games, etc.  Play Civ, Play Starcraft or COH, play Total War, play Stellaris, play age of empires. 

I really did give this game a fair shake, I really did, there's just absolutely nothing in this game that isn't being done better by another game, even in a combined package.

I think this game is more nostalgia bait, if you grew up playing this game, if this was your first RTS or strategy game, you're probably gonna wanna come back to this game and play it a lot, but in terms of actual quality, even the mods don't make up for it.

Speaking of, don't let the near 20,000 mods on the workshop fool you, once you get past page 3 of the most subscribed mods....it's pure bloat and slop.

Now Rise of Legends on the other hand....but that's not on steam.

Hey Microsoft! Have some shame and remaster this game before selling it in 2025! Even the music cracks because it's so old. I play it because Civ series is Turn Based which I don't like as a genre but I wish, I SO WISH that there was a modern RTS Civ! Or a proper Rise of Nations sequel!!
I love this game but 20$ is C R A Z Y for this old ass game LOL
This game did not age well.
play rise of nations on roblox
